author: sky.cactus
content: I believe that this would be the theoretic maximum inflation rate under PoS.  Anything less than 100% participation would have a lower inflation rate.

author: sky.cactus
content: Given that, the current miner rewards are resulting in an inflation rate that is way about the PoS inflation rate, but I'm not sure that that really matters?  In theory, PoS rewards target a security threshold, they don't target an inflation rate.  Now, that security threshold is incredibly hard to calculate (maybe not realistically possible), but I don't think this means we should necessarily just "target something else".

author: sarahhh_81
content: I'm having trouble finding documentation on the format of a raw signed transaction.  Is source code of a client the only documentation on such details?  I can see, for example, in [EIP155](https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/blob/master/EIPS/eip-155.md) that a raw transaction turns out to have a certain header, then the RLP-encoded transactions comes after it and I suppose a signature comes after that, but I can't tell exactly how all the pieces are concatenated.  Any pointers would be appreciated.  (Books like Mastering Ethereum don't get into such details.  I'm not a Go programmer, but I've been studying enough of it to read the go-ethereum source code.  I'll eventually get my answers on my own, but any help to speed me up is appreciated.  Thank you.)

author: sky.cactus
content: A "raw transaction" is just an RLP encoded transaction.  EIP-155 defines it.
